dict.string: Fix a bug that makes upcoming album section empty
Fix a bug that prevents you from changing simple search type on iOS 14 and above. Thank to Rob for reporting this issue.
- Fix buttons in photo viewer not tappable for iPhone X and above. - Fix statistics page error.

- Introduce badge system: a release with more than 10 positive reviews (>=75%) is annotated with a badge üèÖ. - Display band‚Äôs total reviews, overall average rating & total badges. - Display year gap between this year and a band‚Äôs year of formation. - Copy lyric with a simple tap. - Photo viewer detects eyes in background so that the detection process is much faster and does not block the user interface. - Upcoming album section: fixed label priorities so that a long release title does not overlap other informations. - Some font & colour changes to clearly differentiate between full-length and other release types (demo, single, compilation‚Ä¶). - Update underlying libraries to latest version & refactor code structure so that the app is less likely to crash.

- This version comes with user profile page which shows user's reviews, public collection, submitted bands & modification history. - You can also search a user by username in Simple Search page. - You can now quickly go to search page or go back to homepage from anywhere. Simply tap the "+" button and properly choose an option. - Fix error retrieving your collection. - Fix crash when picking a release other version. - Fix some silly broken English.
Special thanks to Lenn for his continuous suggestions.
- Fix app crash when username has spaces - Fix left menu item title

- You can now log in with your Metal Archives account. - Manage your bookmarks: add/remove/edit bands/artists/labels/releases. - Manage your collection: add/remove/edit releases. - Fix reminder creation error. - Create reminder from inside a release page.
- You can now create a reminder for an upcoming album. - Fix Today widget background issue. - Display album title/artist name alongside the cover/photo. - Replace some icons & minor UI fixes.

- Homepage section reordering capacity. You now have full control to your homepage layout. - Today widget ‚ÄúUnable to load‚Äù fix. - A filter by genre for Upcoming Albums list. Thanks to Andreas for the suggestion. - Split releases are now more informative. All involved bands are listed comparing to only the first band in precedent versions. A band name annotation is also added to involved artists who are band member. Thanks to Lenn, once again, for the suggestion. - A minor typo fix in homepage. Thanks to Matt for pointing out.

- Add annotation to instrumental songs in a release (thanks to Lenn for the suggestion). - Upcoming albums section is now on top of homepage. - Artist page with thumbnails for band's logo and release's cover. - And many more small UI changes.
- Integrate Deezer Search & Preview (30 seconds preview) which allows user to listening to band's top tracks and releases inside the app. - Minor UI improvements. - Fix occasional crashes.
- Fix band lyrical themes not being updated. - Fix crashes on iPad.

- Fix crashes on iOS 10 & 11.‚Ä®- Add default discography mode option.‚Ä®- Fix Today Widget's height issue
- Support 3 font size options: default, medium, large.‚Ä®- Integrate Push Notification‚Ä®- Some UI improvements‚Ä®- Homepage now loads each section separately.

This biggest update since the release of the app comes with various new features and a completely new interface.‚Ä®
- The app now has a homepage with almost everything you can do on the web version: statistics, new archives, latest additions/updates/review, upcoming albums... - Much more informative: items are displayed with thumbnails. - Advanced searches are now supported. - Customizable theme with 4 built-in themes. - Customizable today widget. - 3D touch for quick actions: search, random band.
